website_summaries.verdict: Strong, safe, and superbly engineered rack from a reputable brand.
pros: Easy to mount the rack independently
cons: Some criticize its "flimsy" plastic hub assembly
Heavy loads may damage vehicle fender

customer_reviews.title: Great, easy to install bike rack
customer_reviews.text: Great bike rack! I used this on my Subaru Forester to carry two bikes from Chicago to NYC. It was super easy to install with the written instructions (also looked up some videos online), and it stayed in place perfectly for the 900 mile trip. I checked the straps when we stopped every 4 hours or so and they were always in place, no issues even with snow and speeds around 80 mph. Would absolutely recommend
customer_reviews.author: LorettaC

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2004 Infiniti G35 coupe and installed the carrier according to the manual. I took the car and carrier on a 60 mile trip. After the trip I noticed that my back bumper has a dent in it where the carrier was resting. I guess the pressure of the straps and drive pressed the unit enough to cause a dent. THAT SUCKS. Now I have to take the care to the body shop to fix the car. Obviously I sent the unit back. Won't buy Thule again
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied

customer_reviews.title: The rack is easy to mount and holds (2) bikes comfortably
customer_reviews.text: The rack is easy to mount and holds (2) bikes comfortably. The mounting straps that connect to the side and bottom of the rear hatch would be better designed if the had the same cam-latch strap buckle system that the top straps have. Once you add the weight of the bikes you need to tighten the side strap and it would be easier and more effective with the cam-latch instead of the buckle.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Novak

customer_reviews.title: Too big, too sharp
customer_reviews.text: The end caps on this rack are sharp enough to scratch through the paint on your bike when you mount/unmount it. SMALL BUYERS BEWARE. This is not the rack you're looking for. If you are 5'5" or shorter, or have kids, this rack will not fit your bike. I even bought the Thule top tube extender, and my road bike still barely fit. It gets 2 stars instead of 1 because when the bike is on there, it's super secure. Overall it's very stable, but it's too big and sharp enough to damage your bike. I would not recommend this product. I'm going to try to sand it down and ignore the scratch on my bike.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Best value by far
customer_reviews.text: It took a while to find a decent bike carrier but winner, winner chicken dinner on this one. Don't even bother with the garbage they sell at the mass market retailers. I'm a little iffy on the straps that come with it, but I have backups. The instructions are excellent for setup btw. The only problem I had was that the cross reference sheet for where I rack should actually rest on the back of the car and which setting to use didn't seem to make sense.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Stanton

customer_reviews.title: Do your research and maybe it'll work for you
customer_reviews.text: We were so hopeful. We have a Lincoln MKX 08' and it is very difficult to find a trunk mount rack. The hatch makes that very difficult. So we finally decided on this one with lots of research. It works. But we didn't feel the bikes were secure. We didn't want to even drive the highway. We pulled over two times to check them. We ended up returning it after one use. Wish we had more trust in it. We'll have to get a hitch installed.
customer_reviews.author: NJJO

customer_reviews.title: Swings left and right sometimes
customer_reviews.text: In general I am satisfied but I still drive very cautiously with this bike rack and two bikes on. This rack swings left right if you turn hard which makes me nervous. It takes minimum 10minutes Install this rack and put two bikes on. And this rack has to come off in order to open the rear door which is somewhat of a hassle. We have purchased the rack for 3 bikes and so far using it for 2 bikes as it is too tight for 3 adult mountain bikes.
customer_reviews.author: archid_3

customer_reviews.title: Great rack and ease of assembly and mounting makes this ...
customer_reviews.text: Great rack and ease of assembly and mounting makes this bike rack the best I've ever had! I replaced my Thule roof rack with the trunk rack. It's easier to mount, takes minutes, and no damaging the roof trying to put on the roof rack. The quality of this rack is outstanding. Why would someone put on a cheap rack with expensive bikes on it? Great seller; fair price, wide selection & fast shipping. Highly recommend this seller and enjoy your Summer!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Andrus

customer_reviews.title: No no no!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a Thule that inserted into a hitch and it was amazing. This one would not fit my small road bike, as the holders were not adjustable, and what a joke to try to get 2 bikes on. Would not happen. It’s too bad this brand is usually amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Mk

customer_reviews.title: Great for Ford Edge w/Spoiler
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2014 Ford Edge and was a little apprehensive due to the spoiler at the top of the hatch, but it worked perfectly. I believe somewhere in the directions (or maybe a youtube video I found (installing on a Ford Explorer) it was recommended to place the bottom of the trunk mount just underneath the license plate...I didn't do this because the bikes were not level. I rested the bottom trunk mount on the bumper near the hatch release. Travelled to and from northern WI (250+ miles one way) without problems. Would definitely recommend this trunk mount for any Ford Edge owners. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Koziol

customer_reviews.title: Unstable and support arms too far apart
customer_reviews.text: We had to return this item. It’s well made but just not stable enough to strap to the back of our SUV. It fit but with the bikes on it, it would have fallen off. Of course, we couldn’t get the bikes on it because the supports were too far apart to fit the frames of our bikes. Pass on this, get a hitch on your vehicle, and get a rack that you set the bikes into rather than hang them.
customer_reviews.author: Holly AW

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This bike rack works like a charm. I love how easy it is to take on and off the car and how easily it handles two bikes. I use it for my road bike (alone on the rack) and it fits very nicely. I use it to take my hybrid with my wife's hybrid, and once I figured out the best configuration, it also works quite well. My only concern, which is why I gave it a 4 instead of a 5 was when I first assembled it I checked the manual and it said the rack would not fit on my car (Hyudai Sonata - 2015). But it did and I'm quite satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Niemie

customer_reviews.title: I can go anywhere now,,
customer_reviews.text: Fist rack I've ever owned so I was a little apprehensive and intimidated with the installation and the security of my 35-year-old 10-speed road bike being damaged. Easier to install than I thought it would be and it was very secure on the rack as I was on the highway doing 65-70 mph going to my favorite path on the lake. Even carried my 21-speed hybrid along with it (for a friend) and both bikes were very snug with no problem at all. I would just recommend bungee cords to keep tires and peddles from moving during transport. Can't beat it for the money. Works great on my Mercury Milan. No scratches,,,no problems. Strongly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Mark I Archer

customer_reviews.title: Decent rack but no way can I fit 3 bikes on it.
customer_reviews.text: Decent rack but no way can I fit 3 bikes on it. Needed to purchase adapters for female bikes. Easy to install rack. When we put the bikes on the rack, there was no room for 3. We fit two bikes on the first and 3rd mount. Other than this issue it is a very durable and easy to mount rack. Mounted to a 2011 Ford Edge SEL with spoiler.
customer_reviews.author: Essa

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Product was cheaply made and didn’t secure bikes. Strap for bikes was too short. Base seam opens way to much when bikes are added. It definitely would have snapped if I used it. Plus- I had to order a three bike model in order to mount two bikes...Returned! I am installing a hitch on my car for a REAL bike carrier
customer_reviews.author: Deeny

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I checked the manufacturer's website to see if this would properly fit my car before buying. It stated that it would and it most certainly did not. It also did not fit 3 bikes on it at all. This was very disappointing. I would definitely not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: c.rea.97.85

customer_reviews.title: Fit my Hyundai Santa Fe perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: After doing a lot of research, I decided on this Thule bike rack because of reviews and reputation. It did not disappoint! It's very easy to attach to my Hyundai Santa Fe Sport (2013) and it holds the bikes securely. Very sturdy construction and can accommodate a lot of different vehicle types. Definitely glad I purchased this bike rack.
customer_reviews.author: Steven B.

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate Manufacturer’s Website and Fit Guide
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2013 Toyota Corolla with a spoiler. So, I did a lot of research to figure out which rack would fit my car. . The manufacturer’s website and the included fit guide stated this rack would fit my car. I could not get the rack on my car without it contacting the spoiler. The instructions said the bottom arm should rest on the top of the bumper. However, this was not possible, because the top arm rested directly on the spoiler.
customer_reviews.author: David Millanti

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Rack For My Needs
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought a new vehicle, went from having an SUV to a hatchback and could no longer use my hitch carrier I've loved for years. Took the chance on the Thule Passage Trunk Mount Carrier and I couldn't be happier with it. The rack is super secure on my car as well, I loaded my bike and drive for about an hour doing 75-80 mph on the interstate without any vibration or movement from the carrier. I highly recommend this if you're on the fence!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a decent bike rack, and supposedly fit my car, however in reality it didn't work. Two star rating because it fit both mountain bikes pretty comfortably, but it didn't work for my vehicle. I have a 2004 Subaru Legacy 4 door sedan with the factory installed spoiler, and that spoiler was a real issue with putting on a bike rack. I managed to wedge the rack onto the car and load 2 mountain bikes onto it, but it really didn't fit properly and I did not feel comfortable taking it out onto the road. Disappointed by the results and returned this pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Dilger

customer_reviews.title: I've tried to make this work for two bikes several ...
customer_reviews.text: I've tried to make this work for two bikes several times, but the two mount points are just too close together and the bikes just won't fit. It works ok (as long as you don't have a small frame) for one bike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good adjustable rack
customer_reviews.text: This is a good rack; I've used it on 2 different sedans with good fitment and minimal movement of the bike. I do put a terry cloth between my carbon fibre bike frame and the rack, but I have carried an aluminum bike without a cloth and didn't experience damage to the paint. My family has some bikes with odd geometry (Time Trial, women's step-through); these require some interesting mounting strategies to get the bikes on. The TT bike needs to be mounted upside-down and at a 45-degree angle, for example, due to the fact that it has a very small main triangle. I don't know if other racks would offer adjustment options to make this easier or not.
customer_reviews.author: Park Place

customer_reviews.title: It's alright...
customer_reviews.text: It looks very nice and sleek, but got some design flaws which make it very flimsy and kind of a let down. The two rails that stick out to place the bike are somewhat flimsy and move around quite a bit, and you can't bend them downwards to relieve space when you're not using the rack. Second, it does not come with any strap ties, but if you count cheap rubber bands as good enough ties, then it does. I give them a week in the Texas sun to start cracking. Other than that, its a alright and somewhat just for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Bracho

customer_reviews.title: This is it!
customer_reviews.text: Just finished an 820 mile trip with this bike rack. Was really skeptical that any trunk mounted rack would last on the trunk without loosing strap tension but this one did. I had 2 bikes on there and love how it fit my 2006 Maxima (lip spoiler). The bikes did not come anywhere close to the bumper and did not sway while braking. It bounced very little when going through really harsh roads at 67mph. The straps remained tight even through some extremely high winds and disastrous tornado-like thunderstorm. It is a great product for the price and looks well made.
customer_reviews.author: skyline

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike rack for our RAV and it does not fit the model even though on Amazon it said it would fit. Now I'm stuck with the unit and can return it. The only way I found out that the product would not fit is the fitment guide in the box. Not from Amazon or the Thule site.
customer_reviews.author: keith trapp

customer_reviews.title: this is the best trunk-mounted carrier I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: If you are not going to buy a hitch-mounted carrier, this is the best trunk-mounted carrier I have ever had. It is stronger and better made and has extra features to maximize stability. I have always been pleased with Thule products. I once read something about the pleasure of good quality lasting long after the happiness of low price has faded and that applies to Thule.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Weinberg

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This bike rack works great! What I would change if I made this: add Velcro strips so that you could roll the excess straps on this rack and connect it to itself.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: The Thule 910XT Passage 2 Bike Trunk Mount was easy to adjust and size to my '07 Camry
customer_reviews.text: The Thule 910XT Passage 2 Bike Trunk Mount was easy to adjust and size to my '07 Camry. The transporting of the bikes was a smooth and secure ride. Just be sure to adjust the straps a second time after mounting the bikes since there could be some loosening of the straps with the addition of the bikes. I selected this particular model based upon the reputation of the manufacturer (Thule). I am well pleased with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: janet

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, solid, & stable on a cross-country roadtrip
customer_reviews.text: On a nearly 7000 mile round-trip vacation from Texas to Pennsylvania, it worked beautifully on my Prius! Durable and solid function with 2 standard weight adult mountain bikes. Minimal movement, despite bumps, hills and unpredictable freeway traffic. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah & Michele

customer_reviews.title: No spacing between bikes
customer_reviews.text: Not only did rack itself damage bicycle, but bicycle mounts are to close together. Cussing damage to two brand new bikes. Would not recommend for two bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great price. Wo extra expense of having to get ...
customer_reviews.text: Works ok. Great price. Wo extra expense of having to get a hitch welded too. Which could run $1000 for rack and hitch. Seems flimsy. Bike doesn’t stay in place. Wind catches tire and pushes the bike back on the rack.
customer_reviews.author: Pat S.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: I only use this once in a while, but it works fine. Easy to set up. The bike can wobble just a bit - not a really super rigid mount - but it seems safe with one or 2 bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Maser

customer_reviews.title: This is a good bike rack
customer_reviews.text: This is a good bike rack. The only reason I am giving low rating is the fact it doesn't mention anywhere in the description that this will need an extra frame adapter for mounting Women's bike. After I installed the rack on my car, i was disappointed to find that it won't hold my Cannondale Althea bike. Now going to buy the adapter to make this useful.
customer_reviews.author: SatyaYogini

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to install. Works itself loose though. Pretty cheap. Scratches my car as well. Overall pretty disappointing for a decent name brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kr

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Really good bike rack. Bought it for a trip from Michigan to NYC on a 2014 chevy cruze. No issues at all on the way there, and back. My only issue was that it did scratch my bumper on the way back, but it was minor.
customer_reviews.author: Di G.

customer_reviews.title: Check exact car model before you buy.
customer_reviews.text: Had to get it in hand, open the box, and read the manual to find out it would not fit our particular minivan (2014 Sienna). The manual provided a very detailed list of makes and models the rack works with. This should be part of the information available online.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Bond

customer_reviews.title: Easy and stable
customer_reviews.text: Have been on several trips now, up to 10 hours away with two bikes on 2008 Prius. Installs in less than 5 minutes (after you figure it out the first time). Never had any stability issues or issues of bikes sliding towards car etc. Note that the trunk (on Prius anyway) is NOT accessible with bikes on the rack, although it is with just the empty rack. It was inexpensive, and I am not sure what the more expensive models would add, but I would definitely recommend this rack.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Michael

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for transporting your bike
customer_reviews.text: This item was perfect for my bike! This was easy to attach to my car and the straps for the bike were right and firmly held my bike while I was driving.
customer_reviews.author: maggie bolden

customer_reviews.title: This was okay, it just wasn't tall enough to ...
customer_reviews.text: This was okay, it just wasn't tall enough to get my 26" Raleigh wheels off the ground. I had one of the fellows at the bike shop help me with it and he couldn't do it either. I had to go home and get another vehicle with a trailer on it to get my bike home from the bike shop. Not too handy!!!
customer_reviews.author: M.D.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, adaptable to different cars and good price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a bike rack I had that bent. This is much stronger and better quality. It also fits more models of car trunks because you can adjust the arms at different angles. The website tells you what year/make/model you should set the arm to hold the bikes properly. If I ever need another bike rack I'll definitely get a Thule. The price is good too.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Bee

customer_reviews.title: Not very secure and to tight for 3 bikes
customer_reviews.text: Pretty straight forward with assembly. Have Nissan Altima 2015 The problems: The hooks on the trunk are not secure enough and getting loose. Side hooks are not holding on the sides and slide downwards. The grey bottom hooks getting loose The rubber placements for the bikes are to close to have 3 bikes will try to get them more separated with the wood clamps?
customer_reviews.author: James Grafstein

customer_reviews.title: Not the product i was expecting.
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this purchase. The review I read said it was good for SUV, but further investigation through manufacture website indicated it was not suitable for SUV. I was unhappy because it was costly to return this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Anderegg

customer_reviews.title: Better than Saris Bones and compatible with Forester 17
customer_reviews.text: Took two mountain bikes 1 hour drive at 80-85 miles on expressway without issues. Also, had no issues on a different day in some heavy downpour.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Holds up and very customizable to fit a variety of vehicles
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use on a Jeep Compass 2017 and works great. mainly use for two bikes but it gives some extra room.
customer_reviews.author: mtykhk

customer_reviews.title: Easy on and off
customer_reviews.text: Easy on and off, the only thing that I don't like is it's too easy to remove, I can envision someone just stealing it with or without bicycles on it. I would buy it again in a heart beat, keep it in the back seat, it's that easy to put on or off. My car is a 2012 Toyota Prius V
customer_reviews.author: Bruce R

customer_reviews.title: Mount bars too far apart for my bikes
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and the rack fit my car very well, but it would not accept either of my bikes. One was a adult 26" bike , but it did have a double cross bar. The other was a standard boys 24" bike. Neither one could fit as the bars on the mount were too far apart , or too thick.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Vacation Bike support
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2017 Santa Fe and just followed the manual and its a perfect fit
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Use it every day. I used to put bike in trunk. What a hassle. Now easy on easy off
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Very good carrier
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, and did a great job holding my large 29" mens mountain bike even with it loaded with rack and gear.
customer_reviews.author: CDW

customer_reviews.title: MY NEW BIKE RACK
customer_reviews.text: I love my new bike rack, it's pretty easy to put on and take off. I have a 2006 Corolla Toyota and I'm 62 years old, my 7 yr old grandson and I go bike ridding and the two bikes fit good. I did get the one that holds the three bikes so it gives me more room getting the bikes on and off. I can put this on my car within 15 minutes, you do need a little strength to tighten the straps.I would definitely recommend this product,it is made well and strong. Great product. Have fun ridding !!!
customer_reviews.author: KIKI

customer_reviews.title: Good rack for Honda Element
customer_reviews.text: My Honda has a very flat back hatch, so finding a non-hitch bike rack was a challenge. This one seems to do the trick. We've only used it a handful of times, but with success each trip. Since it is straps and hooks, it's important to insure that everything is secure before departing. It can take some doing because, again -- straps and hooks can shift and slide when you get on the road, but I feel confident in the rack and we are planning to use it for an upcoming cross-country trip.
customer_reviews.author: Dirty Centaur

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Fitment, Great Rack System.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fitment, worked great driving the 12+ hours to the Outer Banks. Only negative was the rubber mounts for the bike frames did work their way outward towards the end of the arms. This allowed the bikes to move away from the trunk of the car, and towards the end of the rack. Just double check them to make sure they do not slide off. Otherwise, highly recommend the rack, as it fit my 2014 Cruze very well.
customer_reviews.author: tim

customer_reviews.title: Scratched my car-inspect before installing
customer_reviews.text: If you purchase double check the hooks quality before installing-Left scratches on my Subaru Crosstrek trunk; the product looked used when it came including the hooks that were chipped hence the scratching. Also did not fit my trek "m" bike securely
customer_reviews.author: dakota

customer_reviews.title: it's very easy. I drove from CT to Montreal with this ...
customer_reviews.text: After putting it together initially and getting the hang of where to place the hooks, it's very easy. I drove from CT to Montreal with this on the back of my 2013 Subaru XV Crosstrek and it was fine.
customer_reviews.author: L. Chic

customer_reviews.title: On time and undamaged, but the buttons to release ...
customer_reviews.text: On time and undamaged, but the buttons to release the bike support arms to the folded position work off and on and do not reset to the outward position. It takes some fiddling to fold and unfold the arms.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. MacGregor

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it for the price
customer_reviews.text: I had it setup and configured without about 10 minutes. The instructions were a little confusing, but it's pretty simple to figure it out. The quality seems like it will last and should hold up well. I wanted a bike rack that could fit my truck even when I had a cargo carrier on the back and this seems like it will do the job nicely. I opted to go the route of hatch carrier because I didn't want the rooftop ones to affect my fuel mileage.
customer_reviews.author: Nick..

customer_reviews.title: Bike rack does not secure to vehicle good
customer_reviews.text: This bike rack does not secure the lower part to the body of the vehicle causing the bikes to sway while you're enroute. It also does not fit children's bike size and barely fit mine. I would not recommend this bike rack but Thule does make some other great racks, I guess I'll be purchasing another one now.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey Duke

customer_reviews.title: Secures well
customer_reviews.text: This fits very well on my son's ford escape. It is sturdy when strapped properly which is not hard. He needed it to take the bike into town and ride with his friends and this works perfect. For the money I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Kemp

customer_reviews.title: Very secure.
customer_reviews.text: I have a multi use bike with a high cross bar and the bike fits well and it very secure, even on a bumpy dirt road! Very pleased. Fits well on a Sonic Hatchback
customer_reviews.author: Stef

customer_reviews.title: doesn't slip over bumps in the road and works with my Subaru outback nicely. upgraded to this over an Allen Sports brand ...
customer_reviews.text: so far it's a very solid bike rack. doesn't slip over bumps in the road and works with my Subaru outback nicely. upgraded to this over an Allen Sports brand carrier and noticed the difference on the very first drive.
customer_reviews.author: Teachermom

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: Arms are too far apart for easy loading of mountain bikes. Looks like this thing was engineers for road bikes. Save your money and get an Allen. I owned one before this and was much happier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits my Chevy Cruze just great. I have held up to 2 bikes so far with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Defective theme
customer_reviews.text: Could only carry one bike due to a defective strap retainer hook.
customer_reviews.author: Trent

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Have used on numerous occasions to haul multiple bikes. Use it on my '06 Chevy Impala Pros: Fits 3 bikes, sturdy, travels cross-country (MN to FL) with multiple bikes well Cons: Some difficulty keeping proper placement on trunk - straps need to be 'just right'/in just the right spot. Kind of tricky to get bikes with larger tires (ie. mountain bike) across the mounts. Overall, I give the Thule 3-Bike Mount Carrier a 4-star because of its versatility, sturdiness, and functionality. I would buy it again and I have recommended to others.
customer_reviews.author: N. Burow

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: was a good rack. fit my car perfectly but not my bike
customer_reviews.author: debbie

customer_reviews.title: Super difficult to load my bike on it
customer_reviews.text: Super difficult to load my bike on it. I have an extra bar that I suppose most bikes don't have that makes strappind/unstrapping impossible.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Easy directions and installation process. Keeps the bikes from swaying too much during long trips and stable.
customer_reviews.author: Clarionmeg

customer_reviews.title: Nice carrier, but beware of dents
customer_reviews.text: This carrier works great for my husband and my bikes. It fits two adult bikes well and is easy to mount and use. The negative aspect of this carrier, however, is that after a 130 mile drive, it left a small dent in the bumper of our Jetta. the dent seemed to come out with time, but we haven't used the carrier on a long drive since then.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: glad to have this in my life!!!
customer_reviews.text: im glad i finally found a bike rack for my SUV. Was debating installing a hitch and getting a hitch bike rack but this was truly the better (and cheaper) option. Thule is a great brand and makes great products. A+ all the way!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good purchase. Might have to readjust for an '06 malibu though.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a '06 malibu to carry a 26" ladies mountain bike. The main downside is that, with the bike i am carrying, the Fit Guide in the manual only allowed for 6" of bike tire clearance from the ground. So I had to readjust the rack and buy pipe insulation (rubber foam) for cushion since the new fit setting had the hinge resting on my car. Other than that, works great. Very easy to install and uninstall (after the first time, of course). The bike rack is very secure to the car and no sway issues carrying a heavy 26" bike.
customer_reviews.author: Jojo

customer_reviews.title: We have two bikes
customer_reviews.text: Maybe our two bikes are grossly over-sized but there was no way this would fit both of them. Supposedly holds three bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Terry

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: There's nothing flashy or special about this bike carrier, but it is sturdy and does the job. If you have a small car, or need something cheap to carry bike from place to place, this is perfect. I own a 2003 Pontiac Sunfire, and this worked great. My road bike fits snuggly in the rubber carrier pieces so not to damage the paint. The straps keep the front tire from flailing around or damaging/denting your vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: NAVY04

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I searched for a bike mount and finally bit the bullet and bought this one. With the instructions, first installation takes a few minutes, but is easy after that. There are lots of straps and mounts to keep the bikes sturdy on the vehicle while traveling. I do recommend purchasing some tie downs or simply just strapping the wheels together so they don't spin while driving. Other than that, good quality, easy installation, sturdy, and looks good.
customer_reviews.author: mperu0608

customer_reviews.title: Go with hitch mount if you need more than once a year.
customer_reviews.text: The bikes wobble and bounce, but that’s with any style strap on mount. I’d go with a hitch mount which nowadays can be bolted on at home in an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Subaru Outback 2008 - fits wonderfully. Drove 3600 miles across the country in it
customer_reviews.text: Subaru Outback 2008 - fits wonderfully. Drove 3600 miles across the country in it, and the bike rack only worried me once on the worst road ever - waved, pot-holed, and bumpy. I bought the lock strap and locked the bike to the rack - no trouble with anyone trying to nab the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Diana G.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!!!!
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought I was to be a complicated set up but after reading a few pages of the manual found it to be an easy set up and install. I was going to buy the other set up with the bars and the bike set that goes on top of the car but after using this one I am really happy, mounts easily and dismounts as easy then it folds into a compact unit that gets store in the back of the car (mine is a hatchback).
customer_reviews.author: Sharkie

customer_reviews.title: Great for Traveling
customer_reviews.text: It holds your bikes very well and protect you car from scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Palacio

customer_reviews.title: strong and simple
customer_reviews.text: This is extremely good build quality. Very easy to setup and set down. Carries two bikes quite easily, have not yet tried with 3. I love this one.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Ghosh

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but not easily for smaller bikes
customer_reviews.text: Maneuvering a child's bike and a small woman's bike onto this rack is, frankly, a huge pain. The height of the clips prevent us from sliding the bike frames over the rack as intended so, until we decide to spring for a better rack, we have settled on putting the child's bike on the rack crooked and the woman's bike as intended with the aid of a huge amount of swearing and shoving. The rack would be perfectly fine for larger bikes though.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole C.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and fit my Mazda2.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and fit my Mazda2 perfectly. I found the listing of what setting for a specific car very helpful. Very easy to set up and install. Bike is secure on the rack
customer_reviews.author: online_travels

customer_reviews.title: ... assembling it but it turned out to be very easy. The instructions were clear and the parts snapped ...
customer_reviews.text: I was a little intimidated with making sure I selected the right model that would fit my SUV and assembling it but it turned out to be very easy. The instructions were clear and the parts snapped together easily. The fit instructions provided the right width for the parts that are against the SUV and attaching it was fairly simple. I did have to ask someone the best way to put a bike on the arms--I have a women's bike so it was a little awkward getting it strapped onto the carrier. Overall, I'm pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mj MD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, good value for money
customer_reviews.text: First bike carrier ever purchased. Installed and took on a 1,000 mile car trip to British Columbia, Lake Louise and back. Instructions were very clear. Very sturdy construction. Recommend tying excess strappage of the upper trunk assembly as close to the top hooks as possible and then wrapping back on itself and tying off. This will prevent the straps from working loose.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Constant adjustments needed
customer_reviews.text: Used on a Volvo XC90. On 600 mile trip had to stop numerous times to tighten rack. The side straps never fit correctly in trunk creases. It is also a pain to install. Bikes made it there and back but not without unneeded stress.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: Don't feel that the bikes are on that secure with ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't feel that the bikes are on that secure with my Prius V, but they have stayed secure on city streets so far the few times we used it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Adaptable
customer_reviews.text: Best use of my money ever. From hatch to trunk each weekend it's so adaptable
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs better directions for putting together and installing.
customer_reviews.text: The directions for putting this thing together sucked, but I found some helpful youtube videos and managed after some initial swearing and frustration. Once I got it together it worked really well. It's a very sturdy carrier that I am pleased with.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Sorensen

customer_reviews.title: Used for 1 bike
customer_reviews.text: The Thule is awesome! I can only speak for using it in regards to one bike. I have not tried 2 bikes yet. But I drove 35 miles today and had no problems at speeds as high as 80mph. I suggest you look at the how to video if you want to put it on correctly. The manual is hard to understand in regards to the straps.
customer_reviews.author: Pepperseven

customer_reviews.title: Easy on and off of car
customer_reviews.text: Easy on and off of car. One bike goes on great, second bike is much more difficult but when you figure out a placement for your particular bike it works ok.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Tipton

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike rack!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I have a Corolla S which doesn't work with most bike racks because of the spoiler. This works great with it, very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: M. Montague

customer_reviews.title: Nicely built.
customer_reviews.text: This is very good bike carrier. It can be mounted in just a couple of minutes. I took a 25 mile trip on the expressway driving at 65 mph with one bike mounted on the Thule 910 XT, no problems whatsoever the bike did not move and the straps were in firmly attached to the trunk. The only problem I have is that the straps are too long and if I don't tied them correctly they will be all on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Renato

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my husband. He loves being able to take his bike with him places and not have to use my mini van :)
customer_reviews.author: S. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I am using it on a Hyundai Elantra - its ok. 2 bicycles (1 adult and 1 child) is hard to fit - not sure if it can fit 3. There is no mechanism to prevent bike sway - I had to improvise. Not sure if i would use this to haul bicycles long distance.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Allen

customer_reviews.title: when my cargo area is full or I have multiple bikes this is very useful.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed until I discovered my bike fits in the back if you take off the front wheel. However, when my cargo area is full or I have multiple bikes this is very useful.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Not for my CRV!
customer_reviews.text: The description indicated that I’d be able to use this on my Honda CRV. However, once the package arrived and I checked the manual, I discovered it didn’t. 😢
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Thule is such an amazing company.
customer_reviews.text: This fits both our mini-SUV as well as my Prius Hatchback. Holds bike very firm, yet easy to mount/dismount.
customer_reviews.author: William J Parente

customer_reviews.title: I bought it for an Aztek, but it was ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for an Aztek, but it was designed for an Aztek without the Rally package. It does not attach correctly with that air thing that bisects the rear window.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: easy to understand directions! still able to use trunk very good travel with mount on and loaded!
customer_reviews.author: RNonthemove

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BIKE RACK
customer_reviews.text: GREAT BIKE RACK; CONSISTANT WITH THULE REPUTATION, RUGGED AND THIS MODEL REMARKABLY ADJUSTABLE TO SEVERAL DIFFERENT SEDAN AND SUV STYLES OUR FAMILY DRIVES...
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Stanley D. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Just so-so
customer_reviews.text: I imagine it's difficult to build something to fit so many different shapes as a bike carrier manufacturer has to do. We bought this to use on our Ford Focus (2013) and it was a marginal fit. It works, but I'm not very impressed with how it works with our car. Maybe a different car would yield a different result. I'd give it a 2.5.
customer_reviews.author: David Hale

customer_reviews.title: Great bike rack once you learn how to use it.
customer_reviews.text: Great bike rack once you learn how to use it. Easy to assemble and fits most cars.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica L.

product_meta.title: Thule Passage Trunk Mount Carrier
product_meta.description:
Entry level strap rack featuring Thule's Stay-Put anti-sway cages and patented FitDial hub for precise fit and fold down arms.Thule Fit General Rule: Thule Strap Racks Have Been Designed To Fit Vehicles With Standard Factory Installed Spoilers, Unless Otherwise Specified In Our Fit Guide. Please Note, Thule Cannot Be Responsible For Fits On Vehicles With Aftermarket Spoilers.

AMAZON.COM


The Thule Passage Bike Trunk Mount Carrier is an easy-to-install and use trunk rack carrier with value-added features that make it the perfect choice for an up-and-coming and family oriented cyclists. Designed for either two or three bikes stowed at the rear exterior of your vehicle it features rubber cradles that protect bike frames while holding them securely, patented FitDial hub adjustments that provide the perfect fit to your vehicle, arms that twist down when not in use, an anti-sway feature to prevent bike to bike contact and narrow cradle arms that hold a wider range of bike frames including smaller child frames.

Quality 2-bike trunk carrier transport from Thule that's perfect for new cyclists.
View larger. QUALITY MULTI-BIKE TRUNK CARRYING CAPACITY
The Thule Passage 2-Bike and 3-Bike Trunk Mount Carriers have two and three bicycle carrying capacity. They utilizes Thule's easy-to-use, patented FitDial hub adjustment system for a perfect fit to your vehicle exterior, quick installation and an exclusive push-button feature for for attaching and detaching carrier arms, as well as twisting them to the side then down so they are out of your way when not in use. They also feature soft rubberized cradles that lock down bikes while still allowing complete adjustment along the bike arm, and no-sway Cages that drastically minimize frame movement to keep your bicycles from colliding. The Thule Passage also provides you with a super-stable fit to your vehicle with six straps, a classic black finish that looks great on any and every vehicle and a maximum carrying capacity of 70 lbs.

The FitDial adjustment feature means a fast, perfect fit to every vehicle.
View larger. Rubberized cradles and no-sway cages for drastically minimized movement.
View larger. NO-SWAY, NO-HASSLE FEATURES
Trunk mount carriers do not require a roof rack, are easy to install and offer easy access to bikes. This makes them common, especially with new cyclists and families, but they can also be one of the least stable and awkward options on the road, sometimes leading to bike-on-bike and bike-to-vehicle contact and presenting problems with parking. The Thule Passage Bike Trunk Mount Carrier does away with these issues with its no-sway, no hassle usability. It quickly secures to trunk and/or hatchback seams with multiple straps just like other carriers in its class, but also contains unique setup features. The first of these is a wing adjustment knob and FitDial combo with recommended numerical positions for specific vehicles. This limits the trial and error in how the carrier should lay against your vehicle. Once this optimal fit position is confirmed it is locked into place with easy to turn wing adjustment knobs. Then there is the one-button connection feature for carrier arms, allowing for instantaneous installation, removal and maneuvering of the arms to the side then down and out of the way for parking situations with the carrier on, but empty of bikes. It also features narrow cradle arms, capable of holding a wider range of bike frames including smaller child frames. Most impressive though is the no-sway cage feature. Attaching and extending below each of the rubberized cradles that support your bike frame and attach to the carrier arms, no-sway attachments dramatically reduce bike frame movement front-to-back and side-to-side.

KEY FEATURES
 * Carries up to 2 bikes (2-Bike model) or 3 bikes (3 bike model) on the trunk or hatchback of your vehicle
 * Soft rubber cradles protect bike frame while holding it securely
 * Patented FitDial provides the perfect fit to your vehicle
 * Arms twist to the side, then down when not in use
 * Narrow cradle arms hold a wider range of bike frames including smaller child frames
 * SoftCushion pads protect trunk and hatch
 * Anti-sway functionality to prevent bike to bike contact during transit
 * Vinyl-coated buckles provide firm hold to vehicle and protect against scratches
 * Six strap system secures rack to vehicle

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
Thule Passage Bike Trunk Mount Carrier, all necessary straps and mounting hardware, and instruction guide and warranty information.

LIMITED LIFETIME WARRANTY
Thule will warranty all Thule brand car rack systems and its accessories manufactured by Thule during the time that an original retail purchaser owns the product. This warranty terminates if a purchaser transfers the product to any other person. No warranty is given for defects caused by normal wear and tear, cosmetic rust, scratches, accidents, unlawful vehicle operation, or modification of, or any types of repair of a load carrier system other than those authorized by Thule.

ABOUT THULE
Thule was founded in 1942 by the Thulin family, when Eric Thulin, a true lover of the outdoors, put the Thule name on a pike trap he designed and began to sell in Scandinavia. It wasn't long before he added other practical items to the company's portfolio. By the 1960s, the company began to concentrate on car-related products, including its first roof rack. The Thulin family sold Thule to the publicly listed company Eldon in 1979, and it has continued to grow both organically and through acquisitions ever since. The Thule Group is a world leader in providing transport solutions for an active life.
feature_bullets: Soft Rubber cradles protect bike frame while holding it securely
Stay-Put anti-sway cages prevent bike to bike and bike to vehicle contact
Patented FitDial provides the perfect fit to your vehicle
Arms fold down when not in use
SoftCushion leg pads protect trunk and hatch; Dimensions: 22 x 17 x 34 inch, Folded dimensions:22 x 17 x 24 inch

If you have a bicycle with a non-conventional frame, such as a woman's, child's, or full-suspension bike, you may need a frame adapter to carry your bike on a hanging-style rear mount bike rack. Thule frame adapter: 982XT

GENERAL RULE: THULE STRAP RACKS HAVE BEEN DESIGNED TO FIT VEHICLES WITH STANDARD FACTORY INSTALLED SPOILERS, UNLESS OTHERWISE SPECIFIED. PLEASE NOTE, THULE CANNOT BE RESPONSIBLE FOR FITS ON VEHICLES WITH AFTERMARKET SPOILERS
